attributes.action: Bring back 'nit nurses' in primary schools to check childrens hair regularly
attributes.additional_details: If all parents checked their childrens hair on a regular basis head lice wouldn't be such a problem in schools. Nit nurses should be in schools at least once a week to check all the childrens hair and give advice on treatment for those who do have lice. Treatment for head lice is free where I live (South Tyneside) yet they are still such a problem in schools. Some parents clearly aren't checking/treating their childrens hair.
attributes.background: As a mother with 4 daughters the ongoing problem with head lice in schools is often a source of frustration. At the moment all schools will do is send letters home advising parents there's been a child with head lice but not all parents bother to check their kids hair regularly.
